answerText: "Gimpel the Fool" [or "Gimpel Tam"][10] "Gimpel the Fool" is a short story by this Polish-American-Jewish author whose novels include The Magician of Lublin. He won the Nobel Prize in Literature in 1978, becoming the only Yiddish writer to do so.
heading: Michigan Fall Tournament |2013 | Editors Round 7 | 18 | Literature | World | College
subject: Literature
question: Question: The protagonist of this story claims to have had "seven names in all" while he was still in school: "imbecile, donkey, flax-head, dope, glump, ninny," and one more that stuck. For 10 points each: [10] Name this short story whose title character is a baker married to the verbally abusive Elka.
